front.title: Flow-Aware Pseudowire for the Virtual Private LAN Service

abstract.t: A pseudowire (PW) is used in Virtual Private LAN Service (VPLS)solutions to form any-to-any connections and provide servicedemuliplexing among Provider Edge routers (PEs), and is normallytransported over one single network path. Flow-aware PW enable a PWto take advantage of Equal Cost Multipath (ECMP) and/or LinkAggregation Groups (LAG) in a packet switched network (PSN). PWpackets with a flow label can be transported over multi-paths. Thismethod can apply to the PWs in a VPLS service.This document describes how VPLS solutions utilize a PW with a flowlabel, and defines protocol extension for the provisioning of suchPWs.
